item.title: Reading on the Energy Transition
item.description: I was born a little over a year after the Chernobyl disaster and I grew up around stickers like these. Nuclear energy is not very popular in Germany. It’s just normal to say it’s obviously bad and move on. Chernobyl, Fukushima, giant piles of nuclear waste polluting our planet for tens of thousand of years, what’s not to love. For obvious reasons - the Gas and Climate sandwich crisis - I’ve been trying to answer some obvious questions for myself: is this renewable transition actually realistic or are we just lying to ourselves?

item.title: I knew about the sharp nail and it got me anyway
item.description: I spent the entirety of last morning dealing with the fallout of incorrectly handling a piece of largely unnecessary complexity in the CockroachDB code base. I was familiar with the complexity; I was around when the complexity was introduced many years ago; I field questions (by others working on CockroachDB) about it a few times a year; I was, yesterday morning, working specifically in an area touched by the complexity and in fact had just improved its code documentation.

item.title: Hello World Again
item.description: Hello world, again Decided to given regular blogging a try again since I’ve enjoyed some of my friends and acquaintainces’ newsletters and keep private notes anyway. I have some ideas of what I might write about but I don’t want to scare anyone off :) You can subscribe here and you will receive a non-annoying e-mail whenever there is something new to see here. Responses to that e-mail will reach me and will put a smile on my face.
